etymology.description: 廣(廣) (guǎng, "broad") refers to the vastness or expansiveness, while 州(州) (zhōu, "state; region") is a term used historically for an administrative division or region.
etymology.interpretation: 廣州(廣州) (Guǎngzhōu, "Guangzhou") is named for its historical significance as a broad and expansive region within China. It reflects its status as a major and influential administrative area.

examples.chinese: 我打算明年去广州(廣州)，体验当地文化(體驗當地文化)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dǎsuàn míngnián qù Guǎngzhōu, tǐyàn dāngdì wénhuà.
examples.english: I plan to go to Guangzhou next year to experience the local culture.

examples.chinese: 广州是中国的南方大都市(廣州是中國的南方大都市)。
examples.pinyin: Guǎngzhōu shì Zhōngguó de nánfāng dà dūshì.
examples.english: Guangzhou is a major metropolis in southern China.

examples.chinese: 我昨天在广州(廣州)参加了一场音乐会(參加了一場音樂會)，感受到了城市的魅力(感受到了城市的魅力)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān zài Guǎngzhōu cānjiāle yī chǎng yīnyuèhuì, gǎnshòu dào le chéngshì de mèilì.
examples.english: I attended a concert in Guangzhou yesterday and experienced the charm of the city.
